Budget Analyst 2 (AS 613) Hourly: $17.18 - $33.71 Monthly: $2,978 – $5,843 Annually: $35,734 – $70,117 Budget Analyst 3 (AS 615) Hourly: $19.67 – $38.59 Monthly: $3,410 – $6,689 Annually: $40,914 – $80,267 Please refer to the "Job Specifications" tab located at the top of the LA Careers "Current Job Opportunities" page of the Civil Service website for specific information on salary ranges minimum qualifications and job concepts for each level. Office of Fiscal Operations - School System Financial Services Division Job Focus Areas : This Budget Analyst position, located in the Office of School System Financial Services. This position serves as a lead analyst specializing in central allocation/award processing, allocation review and compliance verification, comprehensive reporting and analysis for all funds received and utilized by sub-grantees through awards from the Louisiana Department of Education (LDOE) . The duties of this positions includes specialized work relative to school finance issues including public school districts, Type 2, Type 3, and Type 5 charter school programs, program administration, programmatic review, program monitoring, and extensive program evaluation and analysis; Monitors and forecasts revenues and expenditures to identify trends and potential funding problems, prepares required reports and financial statements which include the compilation and analysis of data, proposes alternatives to spending and revisions in authorized budget, and prepares budget adjustment forms as necessary to draw or transfer funds. Using Data: The ability to use relevant and valid data to inform a recommendation for action. This position may be filled by a probationary new hire or by promotion of any current permanent classified State of Louisiana employee. Current permanent classified state employees may be required to accept a probationary appointment, if selected. title: Business Development Analyst
description: Primary purpose: Develop business models for new capital projects, working closely with the appropriate sales manager(s), Terminal managers and the designated engineering group. Essential duties and responsibilities: Perform research and market analysis to identify opportunities and/or projects that will enhance the profitability of the assigned assets. Maintain the designated regional master opportunity list in Salesforce and distribute an updated list prior to the bi-weekly regional commercial calls. Work closely with Terminal managers to implement KPI(Key Performance Indicators)/Quality processes with select customers, consolidate data into workable worksheets/presentations and monitor performance and quality process. Assist in project write ups and upon final approval submit the write up, contract document and corporate model to corporate. Vet potential new customers for risk and credit worthiness. Help identify areas where capital projects (expansion, new equipment, etc.) can be justified based on cost savings. Assist commercial account managers in generating revenue and throughput reports, customer presentations and other sales and account management tasks as needed. Participate in sales calls and provide status updates on capital projects, market reports, existing business, and new business development opportunities. Develop presentations as may be needed for reports, QBR's (Quarterly Business Reviews) or other required reviews. The position will focus on the Lower River Region Terminals and may provide assistance with other regions. Other Duties as required and/or requested. Position Requirements Education: Bachelor's degree required. Business, Finance or Marketing degree preferred. MBA or work toward an MBA preferred. Experience / specific knowledge: Advanced knowledge of modeling capital projects using DCF principles. Working knowledge of corporate financials, specifically P&L, Balance Sheets, etc. Strong Excel modeling, advanced PowerPoint skills, and proficient in Microsoft Office and other business applications. 3-5 years’ experience required; 5+ years of experience preferred. Certifications, licenses, registrations: Must have ability to possess a TWIC (Transportation Worker Identification Credential) card. Must possess and maintain a valid motor vehicle operator's license and a driving record satisfactory to the company and its insurers. Competencies, skills, and abilities: Ability to communicate effectively with individuals and groups during sales calls, presentations and other meetings utilizing written, verbal and listening skills. Strong Analytical, financial modeling, and reporting skills required. Must possess strong organizational skills and provide attention to detail. Ability to work with a team, takes direction from supervision, focus attention on details, follow work rules and adhere to work schedules. Be Self-motivated and possess a positive work ethic. Ability to communicate with tact, courtesy, and professionalism via verbal and written interactions. Successful completion of background checks and post offer/random drug screens Learn to understand Kinder Morgan operations and relationship with customer service. Willingness to use personal and/or company vehicles in the course of employment. Must possess Safety training/certification as required by customers to work in their facilities and as required by Kinder Morgan at all locations. The successful candidate will be required to clear a drug screen and a complete background check, after an offer has been extended and prior to being employed. Physical demands: Minimal travel will be required specifically to regional terminals. Extended periods of sitting may be required for administrative activities. Working conditions: Must be willing and able to work in a corporate office and field environment. description: YOUR JOB IS MORE THAN A JOB The 340B Analyst is responsible for 340B compliance, program integrity, and financial optimization of the program within the covered entity(ies) participating in the 340B Drug Discount Program. The 340B Analyst will be tasked with program management and coordination, configuration and maintenance of software systems, providing support for the daily operations of the covered entity to maintain compliant 340B practices, and other projects as assigned by the 340B Program Manager. The 340B Analyst will work alongside 340B Auditor to complete, validate, and document completed audits related to program compliance. The 340B Analyst is also responsible for ensuring continuous alignment between covered entity operations and 340B Policies and Procedures. To accomplish these roles, the 340B Analyst must establish and maintain excellent customer service relations with individuals, committees, and other associated stakeholders in the 340B Program. Your Everyday Coordinates the 340B Drug Pricing Program and maintains the program’s standards. Ensures HRSA requirements for program qualifications are met. Works to continuously improve 340B program performance through program surveillance and identification program optimizations. Escalates any identified compliance issues to covered entity stakeholders and the 340B Manager. Participates in sub-committees of the 340B Executive Oversight Committee to develop and update policies and procedures for the 340B program. Provides education to covered entity pharmacy team and works to ensure pharmacy operations are in alignment with the 340B policies and procedures. Works with affiliated departments (finance, information technology, medical staffing office, etc.) to ensure 340B program integrity. Conducts regular 340B internal audits and data analysis to identify risk and prevent a compliance breach. Documents audit completion/results and communicate results and escalate issues to identified parties. Monitors 340B regulations and legislation, attend ongoing trainings/conferences to help ensure continued compliance with current regulations.
